snsedextend.BIC.run_models(df, upper_order=5)[source]¶

Convenience function: Fit a range of pymc3 models of increasing polynomial complexity. Suggest limit to max order 5 since calculation time is exponential.

snsedextend.BIC.suppress_stdout(*args, **kwds)[source]¶

snsedextend.cc_extrap module¶

snsedextend.cc_extrap.extendCC(colorTable, colorCurveDict, outFileLoc='.', bandDict={'B': 'bessellb', 'I': 'besselli', 'H': 'paritel::h', 'K': 'paritel::ks', 'J': 'paritel::j', 'Ks': 'paritel::ks', 'R': 'bessellr', 'U': 'bessellux', 'V': 'bessellv', 'Z': 'sdss::z', 'g': 'sdss::g', 'i': 'sdss::i', 'r': 'sdss::r', 'u': 'sdss::u'}, colorExtreme='median', colors=None, zpsys='AB', sedlist=None, showplots=None, verbose=True)[source]¶

Function used at top level to extend a core-collapse SED.

Parameters:
  • colorTable – Colortable made by colorCalc.curveToColor :type: astropy.Table
  • colorCurveDict – Dictionary of color curves, such as made by fitColorCurve :type: dict
  • outFileLoc – Place you want the new SED to be saved, default current directory :type: str,optional
  • bandDict – sncosmo bandpass for each band used in the fitting/table generation :type: dict,optional
  • colorExtreme – ‘blue,’median’,’red’ describes which curve extreme to use :str,optional
  • colors – Colors you would like to use for extrapolation :type: list or None,optional
  • zpsys – Magnitude system :type: str,optional
  • sedlist – list of SEDs to extrapolate, if None then uses all SEDs in SNDATA_ROOT :type: list or None,optional
  • showplots – If you would like to see plots as they’re extrapolated :type: Boolean,optional
  • verbose – Printing on? :type: Boolean, optional

Saves extrapolated SED to outFileLoc, and returns an sncosmo.Source SED from the extrapolated timeseries.

snsedextend.cc_extrap.createSNSED(filename, rescale=False)[source]¶

Creates an sncosmo.Source object from a timeseries source (flux in photons/s/cm^2 as in sncosmo,assumes the file is in ergs though)

param filename:Name of file containing the timerseries source :type: str
Parameters:rescale –
If you want to rescale the flux so that it is in photons at the end instead of ergs (divides by
ergs/AA
type:Boolean, optional

sncosmo.Source object

snsedextend.cc_extrap.plotSED(sedfile, day, normalize=False, MINWAVE=None, MAXWAVE=None, saveFig=True, figFile=None, showPlot=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Simple plotting function to visualize the SED file. :param sedfile: SED filename to read

type:str
Parameters:
  • day – The day you want to plot, or ‘all’ :type: double or str (if all)
  • normalize – Boolean to normalize the data
  • MINWAVE – Allows user to plot in a specific window, left edge
  • MAXWAVE – Allows user to plot in a specific window, right edge
snsedextend.cc_extrap.fitColorCurve(table, confidence=50, type='II', verbose=True)[source]¶

Fits color curves calculated in colorCalc module using BIC :param table: colorTable from curveToColor function

type:astropy.Table
Parameters:
  • confidence – Confidence interval :type: double (2.5,25,50,75,97.5),optional
  • type – SN type :type: str,optional
  • verbose – Printing on? :type: Boolean,optional

A dictionary containing colors from the colorTable input as keys, time/color vectors in astropy.Table format as values.

snsedextend.colorCalc module¶

snsedextend.colorCalc.mag_to_flux(table, bandDict, zpsys='AB')[source]¶

Accepts an astropy table of magnitude data and does the conversion to fluxes (flux in ergs/s/cm^2/AA)

Parameters:
  • table – Table containing mag, mag error error, and band columns :type: astropy.Table
  • bandDict – translates band to sncosmo.Bandpass object (i.e. ‘U’–>bessellux) :type: dict
  • zpsys – magnitude system :type:str,optional

astropy.Table object with flux and flux error added (flux in ergs/s/cm^2/AA)

snsedextend.colorCalc.flux_to_mag(table, bandDict, zpsys='AB')[source]¶

Accepts an astropy table of flux data and does the conversion to mags (flux in ergs/s/cm^2/AA)

Parameters:
  • table – Table containing flux, flux error error, and band columns :type: astropy.Table
  • bandDict – translates band to sncosmo.Bandpass object (i.e. ‘U’–>bessellux) :type: dict
  • zpsys – magnitude system :type:str,optional

astropy.Table object with mag and mag error added

snsedextend.colorCalc.curveToColor(lc, colors, bandFit=None, snType='II', bandDict={'B': 'bessellb', 'I': 'besselli', 'H': 'paritel::h', 'K': 'paritel::ks', 'J': 'paritel::j', 'Ks': 'paritel::ks', 'R': 'bessellr', 'U': 'bessellux', 'V': 'bessellv', 'Z': 'sdss::z', 'g': 'sdss::g', 'i': 'sdss::i', 'r': 'sdss::r', 'u': 'sdss::u'}, color_bands=['B', 'V', 'R', 'g', 'r'], zpsys='AB', model=None, singleBand=False, verbose=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

Function takes a lightcurve file and creates a color table for it.

Parameters:
  • lc – Name of lightcurve file you want to read, or astropy Table containing data :type: str or astropy.Table
  • colors – Colors you want to calculate for the given SN (i.e U-B, r’-J) :type: str or list of strings
  • bandFit – If there is a specific band you would like to fit instead of default :type: str,optional
  • snType – Classification of SN :type: str,optional
  • bandDict – sncosmo bandpass for each band used in the fitting/table generation :type: dict,optional
  • color_bands – bands making up the known component of chosen colors :type: list,optional
  • zpsys – magnitude system (i.e. AB or Vega) :type: str,optional
  • model –
    If there is a specific sncosmo model you would like to fit with, otherwise all models mathcing the
    SN classification will be tried
    type:str,optional
  • singleBand – If you would like to only fit the bands in the color :type: Boolean,optional
  • verbose – If you would like printing information to be turned on/off :type: Boolean,optional
  • kwargs – Catches all SNCOSMO fitting parameters here

colorTable: Astropy Table object containing color information
